intro: Polygala rutenbergii, commonly known as the Rutenberg's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are often arranged in racemes and can range in color from white to pale yellow. Polygala rutenbergii is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators in its native habitat.
